parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.34

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates an empty object of given classname type.
See [[Arma 3 Assets]] / [[Arma 3: createVehicle/vehicles]], or [[:Category:CfgVehicles]] for earlier games.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> For objects of type <tt>"Logic"</tt> use [[createUnit]] instead.</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3 </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> To avoid vehicle randomisation in <template><title>arma3</title></template>, set the ''BIS_enableRandomization'' variable immediately after creating the vehicle:
<code>[[private]] _vehicle <template><title>=</title></template> "C_Offroad_01_F" [[createVehicle]] [[position]] [[player]];
_vehicle [[setVariable]] ["BIS_enableRandomization", [[false]]];</code>
Check [[Vehicle Customization (VhC)]] page for more information and settings.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> type [[createVehicle]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - vehicle/object className

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position: [[Position]] - Desired placement position. If the exact position is occupied, nearest empty position is used.

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[createVehicle]] [type, position, markers, placement, special]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [type, position, markers, placement, special]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - vehicle/object className

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> position: [[PositionATL]] ([[PositionAGL]] if boat or amphibious), [[Position2D]], or [[Object]] - desired placement position

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> markers: [[Array]] - (Optional, default []) if the markers array contains any markers, the position is randomly picked from array of given markers plus desired placement position. If any of the markers were given z coordinate with [[setMarkerPos]], the vehicle will also be created at given z coordinate.

</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> placement: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) the vehicle is placed inside a circle with given position as center and placement as its radius.

</value></part><part><name>p26</name>=<value> special: [[String]] - (Optional, default "NONE") can be one of the following:
* <tt>"NONE"</tt> - will look for suitable empty position near given position (subject to other placement params) before placing vehicle there.
* <tt>"CAN_COLLIDE"</tt> - places vehicle at given position (subject to other placement params), without checking if others objects can cross its 3D model.
* <tt>"FLY"</tt> - if vehicle is capable of flying and has crew, it will be made airborne at default height.
If ''special'' is "" or not specified, default <tt>"NONE"</tt> is used.

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Object]] - created vehicle or [[objNull]] if failed

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_jeep = "Jeep" [[createVehicle]] [[position]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_heli = "AH1Z" [[createVehicle]] [[getMarkerPos]] "hspawn";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_veh = [[createVehicle]] ["ah1w", [[position]] [[player]], [], 0, "FLY"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4 </name>=<value> <code>_veh = [[createVehicle]] ["2S6M_Tunguska", [[getMarkerPos]] "marker1", ["marker2", "marker3"], 0, "NONE"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x5</name>=<value> Objects such as
* "test_EmptyObjectForBubbles"
* "test_EmptyObjectForFireBig"
* "test_EmptyObjectForSmoke"
create additional emitters, which are stored in "effects" variable on the object. Since Arma 3 v1.71 these emitters are automatically deleted when object is deleted
<code>[] [[spawn]]
{
	[[private]] _fire = "test_EmptyObjectForFireBig" [[createVehicle]] [[position]] [[player]];
	[[sleep]] 5;
	[[deleteVehicle]] _fire;
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>x6</name>=<value> The following explosives (ending with ''_Scripted'') can be set off by applying [[setDamage]] 1 to them for ease of scripting:
* "DemoCharge_Remote_Ammo_Scripted"
* "SatchelCharge_Remote_Ammo_Scripted"
* "ClaymoreDirectionalMine_Remote_Ammo_Scripted"
<code>_claymore = "ClaymoreDirectionalMine_Remote_Ammo_Scripted" [[createVehicle]] [[position]] [[player]];
_claymore [[spawn]]
{
	[[sleep]] 5;
	_this [[setDamage]] 1;
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>x7</name>=<value> Add inventory to objects without inventory:
<code>_boxes = "Land_Pallet_MilBoxes_F" [[createVehicle]] [[position]] [[player]];
_cargo = "Supply500" [[createVehicle]] [0,0,0];
_cargo [[attachTo]] [_boxes, [0,0,0.85]];

<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>optional for objects that can take damage</value></part></template>
_boxes [[addEventHandler]] ["Killed",
{
	{
		[[detach]] _x,
		[[deleteVehicle]] _x;
	}
	[[forEach]] [[attachedObjects]] (_this [[select]] 0);
}];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x8</name>=<value> Drop player's weapon:
<code>_wh = "GroundWeaponHolder_Scripted" [[createVehicle]] [[position]] [[player]];
[[player]] [[action]] ["DropWeapon", _wh, [[currentWeapon]] [[player]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x9</name>=<value> The following weapon holders (ending with ''_Scripted'') do '''not''' auto-delete when empty. It is up to the mission maker to take care of these:
* "GroundWeaponHolder_Scripted"
* "WeaponHolderSimulated_Scripted"
* "Weapon_Empty" (a special weaponholder that displays only a single weapon, even if it contains magazines for this weapon)
<code>[[private]] _weaponHolder = [[createVehicle]] ["Weapon_Empty", [[getPosATL]] [[player]], [], 0, "CAN_COLLIDE"];
_weaponHolder [[addWeaponCargo]] ["arifle_Katiba_F", 1];
[[hint]] "You have 5 seconds to grab this weapon";
[[sleep]] 5;
[[deleteVehicle]] _weaponHolder;
</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[createVehicleLocal]], [[createVehicleCrew]], [[createAgent]], [[createTrigger]], [[createUnit]], [[createMine]], [[deleteVehicle]], [[createGroup]], [[createCenter]], [[setVehiclePosition]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 22, 2015 - 13:04 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:MrSanchez|MrSanchez]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
GroundWeaponHolder class is automatically deleted when empty after 0.5 to 1 seconds in A3 1.48. The exact delay is random but never lower than 0.50 secs after creation. You can stop deletion by adding something (cargo) to it within 0.5 seconds.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 16, 2017 - 09:05 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:AgentRevolution|AgentRev]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For the alternative syntax, if the vehicle has <tt>canFloat = 1;</tt> in its config class (e.g. boats and wheeled APCs), the command expects [[PositionAGL]], and otherwise always [[PositionATL]].
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 2, 2018 - 12:16 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:demellion|demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
'''WARNING:''' Do not instigate [[createVehicle]] or [[createVehicleLocal]] within a server function executed with [[Functions_Library_(Arma_3)#Pre_and_Post_Init|preInit]] flag.<br> This will cause ''"You cannot play/edit this mission"'' for a vehicles compiled from a [[Arma_3_Startup_Parameters|-mod]] and make server skip/loop that mission init.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 10, 2019 - 09:10 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:R3vo|R3vo]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The main syntax creates vehicles at ground level ignoring the Z in ''pos'' and is also faster than the alternativ syntax.
<code>"vehclass" [[createVehicle]] ''pos'';</code> This is equivalent to <code>[[createVehicle]] ["vehclass", [''pos'' [[select]] 0, ''pos'' [[select]] 1, 0], [], 0, "NONE"];</code>
</dd>
</dl>

<comment><!-- Notes Section END --></comment></root>
